title: BUFT’s 2-day entrepreneurship expo begins
body: The Business Club of BGMEA University of Fashion and Technology inaugurated a two-day National Entrepreneurship Expo 2025under the theme ‘leadership and how to create success at the BUFT in Dhaka on Sunday. The event, powered by Taza Hair Oil and Prime Bank, and co-powered by Step Footwear, KOI The Bangladesh, and MSI International, is featuring a variety of activities, including a business case competition, panel discussions, seminars, cultural shows, and training sessions, said a press release. More than 50 stalls showcasing handmade crafts, fashion, food and various other categories from different parts of the country are participating in the fair. The fair was attended by guests, including Faruque Hassan, chairman of the BUFT board of trustees; acting vice-chancellor Professor Ayub Nabi Khan; film artistes Ananta Jalil and Afia Nusrat Barsha; Imtiaz Ahmed Imon, CEO of Taza Hair Oil; Shaila Abedin, senior executive vice-president of Prime Bank; MM Mahbub Hasan, senior vice-president of Prime Bank; Aminul Islam Shamim, CEO of Step Footwear; and Sheikh Mohammad Imran, adviser of the BUFT Business Club, along with several entrepreneurs, corporate leaders, faculty members, officials and students.
